Pre-Game Insights: England is currently placed at the bottom of the table with just one win.
The English batting has failed to perform with no batter seeming in any sort of form.
Similarly, the bowling has continued its dismissal performance and struggled to cope up with the Indian conditions.
Sri Lanka has had a forgettable tournament with one win after three back-to-back losses.
The Lankans have shown flashes of brilliance but the lack of performances have cost them results.
The batting has had a few great performances but has lacked consistency.
But the bowling has severely lacked control and failed to pick up wickets at regular intervals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The M.Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru has produced incredible batting tracks with an average score of 266.
Fast bowlers can come into play early in both innings with a new ball while spinners can pick up wickets if the ball starts gripping.
